snippet: The agreement reached in Lima, Peru, would be a breakthrough in 20 years of efforts to create a global warming accord, but it falls short of what scientists say is needed.
abstract: News analysis; greenhouse gas agreement in Lima, Peru is first to involve every country in world, but provisions fall short of those scientists say are required to stave off global warming; accord is further weakened by lack of legally binding measures and threat of sanctions, with each country agreeing to enact its own emissions laws based on good faith alone; it is unclear whether international peer pressure will be enough to affect change.
lead_paragraph: The agreement reached in Lima, Peru, would be a breakthrough in 20 years of efforts to create a global warming accord, but it falls short of what scientists say is needed.

headline.main: A Climate Accord Based on Global Peer Pressure
headline.print_headline: A Climate Accord Based on Global Peer Pressure

keywords.value: United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change
keywords.name: subject
